page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: Most of our surveyed area consists of fertile farmland,dotted with disused mine shafts and spoil heaps from the abandoned tin mine workings.High Cornish hedges separate the fields and the narrow country lanes.In places trees growing in the top of the hedges meet over the lanes forming a tunnel.The only other trees,mainly deciduous,are to be found along the banks of the streams.The farming is a mixture of horticultural,including several nurseries,dairy and beef cattle and some sheep.Tourism is a flourishing industry as seen by the purpose built Tolroy Holiday Village and Calloose Caravan Park.In the summer months many farms rent out a field for camping and caravaning and private houses display "Bed & Breakfast" signs.
